{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3327996,"name":"Yanki K.","username":"yankee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yankee/{size}/173464_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T19:25:37.371Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

As 6838, we attended the Istanbul Regional last week. During some of the practice and qualification matches, we had communication issues that were likely caused by the damaged ethernet cables. After changing the cables, the robot connected perfectly for the last 4 qualification matches we played. The incident is that, during our second playoff match, match 6, the robot was suddenly disabled. We have checked the following cases:

  • Did not have any short circuits.
  • The connection to the robot was not interrupted at any time during the match.
  • The power was not cut off during the match.
  • We did not have any CAN errors.
  • The joysticks were connected to the computer during the whole match.

Also, we talked to the FTA and CSA, they said there was not any problem with the FMS.

Below are the screenshots of the DS logs.

driverstation Logs Match 61920×1022 176 KB

match 6 driver station event list1920×1022 230 KB

Basically, even though the connection and the power were normal, the robot was disabled without any error or information message on either FMS or DriverStation. Is there any other team who faced this issue? Or, is there any advice not to face this issue again?

Thanks for any contribution.

We did not deploy a different code after the first playoff match which we did not face any issues. And the code worked normally when we tried after the match. So, I believe the code did not crash.

Theres weird stuff that happens during a match. For example our team had our robot code crash when a certain button was pressed. Comb through the ds logs and see if any stacktraces were thrown

Even more interesting is that our robot was disabled randomly, the drivers did not press any button nor hit the robot.

At Northern Lights we had our robot disable/crash because of a code issue that never showed up prior in any matches. I’d always recommend looking at stacktraces that might have been thrown because it could be a try/catch that was never added (like in our case).

I’m assuming that the field staff didn’t disable it, intentionally or accidentally, and that you asked about that.

Nope, according to our conversation with CSA and FTA, there is nothing wrong with the staff or the FMS.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T21:52:46.737Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":58.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457930,"topic_slug":"robot-disabled-during-the-match","display_username":"Yanki K.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48849,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-disabled-during-the-match/457930/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328170,"name":"Doug Frisk","username":"Doug_Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T21:53:06.631Z","cooked":"

Prior to the Duluth events I purchased a selection of decent quality Cat 6 shielded patch cables of varying length. As I was walking through the pits I was offering new cables to any team with a radio Ethernet cable that looked home made. Some took me up on the offer, some didn’t. I want to see everyone compete to their best and that’s one thing where teams will use something they found in a drawer to their detriment.

You wouldn’t use a bent hex shaft or damaged wheel on your robot. Same thing here, except a quality cable costs less than a wheel.

Not sure if it helps, but there is another stream with a static view and it seems like, you had a minor collision with another robot right before becoming disabled.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T22:25:15.417Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":57.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457930,"topic_slug":"robot-disabled-during-the-match","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtu.be/ApXotXnQLLA?t=24116","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-disabled-during-the-match/457930/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328200,"name":"Eric Ward","username":"bathtubed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T22:36:53.426Z","cooked":"

The log shows me that the robot was not technically disabled.
The colored lines at the top show the mode that the FMS/driver station is in and the mode the robot is in.
The blue indicates that the robot was in teleop for the entire match as normal.
If a robot is ever e-stopped, loses connection to the DS, or the code crashes, you would see missing teleop segments here.
So it seems to be it was enabled in teleop.

We might be able to help diagnose if we could see the messages around when you were “disabled” which would be indicated by blue timestamps on the left side of your event log.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T22:36:53.426Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":206,"readers_count":205,"score":71.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457930,"topic_slug":"robot-disabled-during-the-match","display_username":"Eric Ward","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35208,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3637 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disabled-during-the-match/457930/11","custom_user_title":"3637 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328243,"name":"","username":"Nick197","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T00:14:09.311Z","cooked":"

At the end of match the LED orange pattern changed from the streaking LED to being still. What normally occurs with the LEDs when the robot is disabled?

As an aside, this camera work is a nightmare! So many frequent shots of robots not in frame or not moving.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T00:14:09.311Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":188,"readers_count":187,"score":42.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457930,"topic_slug":"robot-disabled-during-the-match","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43191,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-disabled-during-the-match/457930/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328358,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T04:09:43.468Z","cooked":"

The RSL pattern is: Solid is disabled, flashing is enabled.

If the RSL is flashing, and the robot is not responding, then it’s likely something in your code or your wiring going away from the RIO. Or either radio or RIO reset from a hit, though given that connection wasn’t interrupted it probably wasn’t the radio.

Dummy question 1: RIO 1 or RIO 2?
Dummy question 2: Have you checked for loose wires since that match?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T04:09:43.468Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":44.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457930,"topic_slug":"robot-disabled-during-the-match","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":43191,"username":"Nick197","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/e9a140/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disabled-during-the-match/457930/13","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328417,"name":"Eric Ward","username":"bathtubed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T07:43:36.001Z","cooked":"

I believe Nick was referring to the addressable LEDs on the robot.

If you watch the video, you can actually see the LEDs continue to regularly flash in a pattern during the match, and then when the match ends they pause.

This heavily implies that they have teleop code which sets the LEDs and reaffirms what I said which is that their teleop routine is running normally and connected to the driver station.

Most likely this means there was either a code error where a command was shutting off their controls, or a literal joystick USB disconnect error.

I am not sure about the RSL btw. During the match, I was the technician, so I remember that it was solid. But, I can’t see from the stream, so not sure.

We use Rio 1 and checked the wirings. Even if we missed a broken wire, we enabled the robot after the match to see if it worked. There wasn’t any problem.

The addressable LEDs’ behavior depends on whether there is a note inside the robot. This command is defined as a default command for the subsystem LED in the RobotContainer.

The logs show that the joysticks were connected during the match, as the drivers confirmed. Also, the code did not have any issues during the previous matches. That is why I struggle to understand the problem.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-09T07:49:08.486Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":26.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457930,"topic_slug":"robot-disabled-during-the-match","display_username":"Yanki K.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":35208,"username":"bathtubed","name":"Eric Ward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48849,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-disabled-during-the-match/457930/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328421,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T08:11:39.379Z","cooked":"

Rio 1 rules out an SD card issue, which Rio 2s occasionally get.

RSL solid… If it was actually solid then something interrupted the robot’s operation. Typically that would be a radio or Rio reboot… and equally typically those would show up in someone’s monitoring. If it wasn’t that, then I’d probably suspect something obscure in the code.

A couple more questions real quick:
a) I assume you turned the robot off when removing it from the field, please confirm?
b) What sensors do you have, particularly of the accelerometer or gyro type?

I’m suspecting that there was something about the hit that scrambled a sensor’s data in such a way that the Rio didn’t know how to handle it, and simply stopped functioning at that point. I couldn’t say what exactly, but I can say that it’s not the first time faulty/no sensor data has caused issues for a team*… and an accelerometer/IMU/gyro is the most likely culprit IMO.

*2012 Einstein, read the report in the archived game documentation for details but someone had a sensor that was on the blink, and as a result their robot failed to move after early auto mode. Difference is, theirs was repeatable.

Just want to echo what I said before, which is that the log messages in the DS event list from right before and after the crash would be very telling.

I can see in the DS logs that there are a series of red events during normal operation followed by none after.

b) We use Pigeon2 as a gyro. Besides, a beam sensor, a limit switch, REV Hex encoder, CANCoders for swerve modules, and TalonFX built-in encoders.
